description: IntelliSense (Pylance), Linting, Debugging (multi-threaded, remote), Jupyter Notebooks, code formatting, refactoring, unit tests, and more.
python.command.python.startREPL.title: Start REPL
python.command.python.execInDedicatedTer: Run Python File in Dedicated Terminal
python.command.python.viewOutput.title: Show Output
python.command.python.reportIssue.title: Report Issue...
python.command.python.enableSourceMapSup: Enable Source Map Support For Extension Debugging
python.createEnvironment.contentButton.d: Show or hide Create Environment button in the editor for `requirements.txt` or other dependency files.
python.createEnvironment.trigger.descrip: Detect if environment creation is required for the current project
python.menu.createNewFile.title: Python File
python.activeStateToolPath.description: Path to the State Tool executable for ActiveState runtimes (version 0.36+).
python.autoComplete.extraPaths.descripti: List of paths to libraries and the like that need to be imported by auto complete engine. E.g. when using Google App SDK, the paths are not in system path, hence need to be added into this list.
python.condaPath.description: Path to the conda executable to use for activation (version 4.4+).
python.defaultInterpreterPath.descriptio: Path to default Python to use when extension loads up for the first time, no longer used once an interpreter is selected for the workspace. See [here](https://aka.ms/AAfekmf) to understand when this is used
python.diagnostics.sourceMapsEnabled.des: Enable source map support for meaningful stack traces in error logs.
python.envFile.description: Absolute path to a file containing environment variable definitions.
python.experiments.enabled.description: Enables A/B tests experiments in the Python extension. If enabled, you may get included in proposed enhancements and/or features.
python.experiments.optInto.description: List of experiment to opt into. If empty, user is assigned the default experiment groups. See [here](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-python/wiki/AB-Experiments) for more details.
python.experiments.optOutFrom.descriptio: List of experiment to opt out of. If empty, user is assigned the default experiment groups. See [here](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-python/wiki/AB-Experiments) for more details.
python.experiments.pythonSurveyNotificat: Denotes the Python Survey Notification experiment.
python.experiments.pythonPromptNewToolsE: Denotes the Python Prompt New Tools Extension experiment.
python.experiments.pythonTerminalEnvVarA: Enables use of environment variables to activate terminals instead of sending activation commands.
python.experiments.pythonTestAdapter.des: Denotes the Python Test Adapter experiment.
python.experiments.pythonREPLSmartSend.d: Denotes the Python REPL Smart Send experiment.
python.experiments.pythonRecommendTensor: Denotes the Tensorboard Extension recommendation experiment.
python.globalModuleInstallation.descript: Whether to install Python modules globally when not using an environment.
python.languageServerDebug.description: Whether debug should be enabled for Positron's Python language server.
python.languageServerLogLevel.descriptio: Controls the [logging level](https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#levels) of Positron's Python language server. Requires a restart to take effect.
python.languageServer.description: Defines type of the language server.
python.languageServer.defaultDescription: Automatically select a language server: Pylance if installed and available, otherwise fallback to Jedi.
python.languageServer.jediDescription: Use Jedi behind the Language Server Protocol (LSP) as a language server.
python.languageServer.pylanceDescription: Use Pylance as a language server.
python.interpreter.infoVisibility.descri: Controls when to display information of selected interpreter in the status bar.
python.interpreter.infoVisibility.onPyth: Only display information if Python-related files are opened.
python.logging.level.description: The logging level the extension logs at, defaults to 'error'
python.logging.level.deprecation: This setting is deprecated. Please use command `Developer: Set Log Level...` to set logging level.
python.missingPackage.severity.descripti: Set severity of missing packages in requirements.txt or pyproject.toml
python.pipenvPath.description: Path to the pipenv executable to use for activation.
python.tensorBoard.logDirectory.descript: Set this setting to your preferred TensorBoard log directory to skip log directory prompt when starting TensorBoard.
python.tensorBoard.logDirectory.markdown: Tensorboard support has been moved to the extension [Tensorboard extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-toolsai.tensorboard). Instead use the setting `tensorBoard.logDirectory`.
python.tensorBoard.logDirectory.deprecat: Tensorboard support has been moved to the extension Tensorboard extension. Instead use the setting `tensorBoard.logDirectory`.
python.terminal.activateEnvInCurrentTerm: Activate Python Environment in the current Terminal on load of the Extension.
python.terminal.activateEnvironment.desc: Activate Python Environment in all Terminals created.
python.terminal.executeInFileDir.descrip: When executing a file in the terminal, whether to use execute in the file's directory, instead of the current open folder.
python.terminal.focusAfterLaunch.descrip: When launching a python terminal, whether to focus the cursor on the terminal.
python.terminal.launchArgs.description: Python launch arguments to use when executing a file in the terminal.
python.testing.autoTestDiscoverOnSaveEna: Enable auto run test discovery when saving a test file.
python.testing.debugPort.description: Port number used for debugging of tests.
python.testing.promptToConfigure.descrip: Prompt to configure a test framework if potential tests directories are discovered.
python.testing.pytestArgs.description: Arguments passed in. Each argument is a separate item in the array.
python.testing.pytestPath.description: Path to pytest (pytest), you can use a custom version of pytest by modifying this setting to include the full path.
python.testing.unittestArgs.description: Arguments passed in. Each argument is a separate item in the array.
python.venvFolders.description: Folders in your home directory to look into for virtual environments (supports pyenv, direnv and virtualenvwrapper by default).
python.venvPath.description: Path to folder with a list of Virtual Environments (e.g. ~/.pyenv, ~/Envs, ~/.virtualenvs).
walkthrough.pythonWelcome.title: Get Started with Python Development
walkthrough.pythonWelcome.description: Your first steps to set up a Python project with all the powerful tools and features that the Python extension has to offer!
walkthrough.step.python.createPythonFile:
[Open](command:toSide:workbench.action.files.openFile) or [create](command:toSide:workbench.action.files.newUntitledFile?%7B%22languageId%22%3A%22python%22%7D) a Python file - make sure to save it as ".py".
[Create Python File](command:toSide:workbench.action.files.newUntitledFile?%7B%22languageId%22%3A%22python%22%7D)
walkthrough.step.python.createPythonFold:
[Open](command:workbench.action.files.openFolder) or create a project folder.
[Open Project Folder](command:workbench.action.files.openFolder)
walkthrough.step.python.installPythonWin:
The Python Extension requires Python to be installed. Install Python [from python.org](https://www.python.org/downloads).

[Install Python](https://www.python.org/downloads)
walkthrough.step.python.installPythonMac:
The Python Extension requires Python to be installed. Install Python 3 through the terminal.
[Install Python via Brew](command:python.installPythonOnMac)
walkthrough.step.python.installPythonLin:
The Python Extension requires Python to be installed. Install Python 3 through the terminal.
[Install Python via terminal](command:python.installPythonOnLinux)
walkthrough.step.python.selectInterprete:
Choose which Python interpreter/environment you want to use for your Python project.
[Select Python Interpreter](command:python.setInterpreter)
**Tip**: Run the ``Python: Select Interpreter`` command in the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands).
walkthrough.step.python.createEnvironmen: Create or select a Python Environment

Create an environment for your Python project.
[Create Environment](command:python.createEnvironment)
**Tip**: Run the ``Python: Create Environment`` command in the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands).
 üîç Check out our [docs](https://aka.ms/pythonenvs) to learn more.

Create an environment for your Python project or use [Select Python Interpreter](command:python.setInterpreter) to select an existing one.
[Create Environment](command:python.createEnvironment)
**Tip**: Run the ``Python: Create Environment`` command in the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands).
walkthrough.step.python.runAndDebug.titl: Run and debug your Python file
walkthrough.step.python.runAndDebug.desc:
Open your Python file  and click on the play button on the top right of the editor, or press F5 when on the file and select "Python File" to run with the debugger. 
  
[Learn more](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/python/python-tutorial#_run-hello-world)
üé® Explore all the features the Python extension has to offer by looking for "Python" in the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands). 
 üìà Learn more about getting started with [data science](command:workbench.action.openWalkthrough?%7B%22category%22%3A%22ms-python.python%23pythonDataScienceWelcome%22%2C%22step%22%3A%22ms-python.python%23python.createNewNotebook%22%7D) in Python. 
 ‚ú® Take a look at our [Release Notes](https://aka.ms/AA8dxtb) to learn more about the latest features. 
 
[Learn More](https://aka.ms/AA8dqti)

üé® Explore all the features the Python extension has to offer by looking for "Python" in the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands). 
 üìà Learn more about getting started with [data science](command:workbench.action.openWalkthrough?%7B%22category%22%3A%22ms-python.python%23pythonDataScienceWelcome%22%2C%22step%22%3A%22ms-python.python%23python.createNewNotebook%22%7D) in Python. 
 ‚ú® Take a look at our [Release Notes](https://aka.ms/AA8dxtb) to learn more about the latest features. 
 
[Follow along with the Python Tutorial](https://aka.ms/AA8dqti)
walkthrough.pythonDataScienceWelcome.tit: Get Started with Python for Data Science
walkthrough.pythonDataScienceWelcome.des: Your first steps to getting started with a Data Science project with Python!
walkthrough.step.python.installJupyterEx:
If you haven't already, install the [Jupyter extension](command:workbench.extensions.search?"ms-toolsai.jupyter") to take full advantage of notebooks experiences in VS Code!
 
[Search Jupyter extension](command:workbench.extensions.search?"ms-toolsai.jupyter")
walkthrough.step.python.createNewNoteboo: Create or open a Jupyter Notebook

Right click in the file explorer and create a new file with an .ipynb extension. Or, open the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands) and run the command 
``Jupyter: Create New Blank Notebook``.
[Create new Jupyter Notebook](command:toSide:jupyter.createnewnotebook)
 If you have an existing project, you can also [open a folder](command:workbench.action.files.openFolder) and/or clone a project from GitHub: [clone a Git repository](command:git.clone).
walkthrough.step.python.openInteractiveW:
The Python Interactive Window is a Python shell where you can execute and view the results of your Python code. You can create cells on a Python file by typing ``#%%``.
 
To open the interactive window anytime, open the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands) and run the command 
``Jupyter: Create Interactive Window``.
[Open Interactive Window](command:jupyter.createnewinteractive)
walkthrough.step.python.dataScienceLearn:
üìí Take a look into the [Jupyter extension](command:workbench.extensions.search?"ms-toolsai.jupyter") features, by looking for "Jupyter" in the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands). 
 üèÉüèª Find out more features in our [Tutorials](https://aka.ms/AAdjzpd).  
[Learn more](https://aka.ms/AAdar6q)
